text: I just needed a couple copies of my apartment key so that if I got locked out I would have one hidden. I never had to directly interact with anyone which was a plus. It was simple put the key in like you're putting it in the door and pick out which key you want and I was going to get two keys and it said that I could get a key for free so I ended up getting three keys for everything included around $20. It didn't take that long. They all worked in my door and I made sure that I did the fingerprint in case I ever get locked out of my apartment. All I have to do is go to the kiosk and do the fingerprint and get another key. That's worth its weight in gold. Above all I was very pleased except for I could have got it cheaper somewhere else but sometimes you get what you pay for. I would use them again..

text: David Jackson, I greatly appreciate you sitting down with me and discussing the different types of products that ADT has to offer. Thank you for helping get my set up done as soon as possible. I do not know what kind of wand Mr. Jackson has under his sleeve, but it must be  really good because he was able to get me on the install schedule extremely fast. I recently had an issue so I wanted to secure my property and feel safe at home once again. ADT has an excellent set of products, many cameras and motion sensors, window monitors, temp controls, etc. What I like so far about the set up is that I can view all of the security on my phone and also on any computer.  I am looking forward to hearing from Mr. Jackson in the future and I hope to have a fantastic relationship with ADT. Thank you

text: I called ADT to request service/repair of 3 year old system, which was installed by ADT. Telephone Representative very helpful in setting up appt. She told me that there would be no charge for the service call as our monthly charge includes the warranty. Service appt. was for the next day - very quick in getting an appt. Service tech - Jonathon Givens - had to replace two door sensors. He then proceeded to tell my wife that our system was outdated and needed to be updated. He offered to update it for a $100 fee. My wife told him she would have to speak with me first before we agreed to anything resulting in a charge. Jonathon then asked my wife how long had we had our system. She told him three years in our current home and approximately seven years in our previous house (total of approximately ten years with ADT.)  He then said he'd go ahead and update our system for no charge, which he did. What was that about??  Offer to update the system for $100?  Would that be considered fleecing a client? And if he was going to update the system for $100, does he pocket the amount, since he updated the system anyway. Kind of "sketch" as the kids say these days.  I have not been impressed with ADT monitoring services in the past, and only continued service with them after the 2 year contract (at which time they were going to increase my monitoring price $10/month.) They agreed to keep it at the same rate as long as I agreed to another 2 years.  When the 2 years are over, I'm finished with ADT.

name: Charles Hill
text: ADT was here on time.  Tech ( Dakoda Blietz) was outstanding.  Very Polite, nice & professional young man.

name: OLUSINA AKINDURO
text: Jonathan Givens was very professional, courteous and did an exceptional job in a timely manner.

name: Adnan Sabir
text: Extremely dissatisfied.

resp.text: Yikes Adnan!- We're very sorry to learn of your unsatisfactory experience as an ADT family member! Please email our team directly at Alwaysthere@adt.com with more info in regard to your issue and the full address in which the services are located, so we may help you further. ~ Thank you

name: Jay Williams
text:
I was an 11 year customer of ADT. I was excited to move to a new home and take ADT with me. Unfortunately my mom passed away the day before ADT was set to install. Even under all that pressure I remembered to call and cancel the install while I was out of town. I've been out of pocket for weeks trying to handle mom's business, grieve, and still live so I haven't had a chance to reschedule. ADT proceeded to still charge me two months of service at my old location even though they knew I had cancelled the service at my old house. When I caught it, the call center manager told me that they still bill you 30 days after you cancel. I asked about the other month and she said "oh we prorated that and took it out of your installation fee." So I prepaid $100 for an install that I didn't get. And they took money out of my installation fee for two more months before I caught it. All this while they say sorry for your loss but...at least we gave you back the second month. So instead of $100 back I got about $50. Even during our time with them we were paying several months during one of their glitches and they weren't even monitoring my home.

No more ADT for me. EVER. And I'll let everyone I know not to get ADT. There are other options now.

resp.text: Hello Jay. Our condolences for your recent loss! We'd like to look into your concerns further to help. Could you please email us the phone number and address associated with your account to AlwaysThere@adt.com? Thank you. -Andrew

Paid over $200 for a really crappy tint job. Tint has streaks and bubbles. In addition, there is overspray from the solution they used to apply the tint all over the interior of my Accord, in addition to streaks of it running down the doors. They literally sprayed what looked like gallons of this crap on my windows and let it run down through the interior of the door onto the ground. Is that not going to screw up my electrical?

Meanwhile, the woman who was telling everybody what to do was nothing short of a witch. She kept shouting at people, cursing, and was very rude to me. One of the tint guys was making fun of the rims on my car while another kept spitting tobacco juice on the ground all around it. Then the owner lit up a cigarette and went to work on my window, blowing smoke all in my interior.

Why should I pay for this??? Incompetent staff, rude management, and an overall really bad experience. Don't waste your time. There are plenty of good tint shops in town without fooling with these people.

text: If I could score lower than 1 star, I would. For starters, my boyfriend dropped my car off on a Monday Morning with the promise that the turn around would be no more than 24 hours. As the days pass, he called for an update. After having several phone calls ignored, he finally went up there on Wednesday. The owner had a million excuses as to why the car wasn't complete, while he's sitting outside smoking a cigarette (doing nothing). He then told my boyfriend that he swears it will be done by 5pm the following day. My boyfriend went to get the car at 4:45 and it STILL was not complete, there was 1 window without tint. Of course, my boyfriend is upset and when he expressed his disappointment,  the owner cursed him out like it was his fault. Friday rolls around, it's after lunch and my car is STILL NOT FINISHED😠😠!!  MIND YOU, MY CAR HAS BEEN AT HIS SHOP SINCE MONDAY!!! DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THESE PEOPLE. If you pay with credit card they'll ask for a "Cash Deposit" 🤔🤔 I will never refer anyone to them or do business with them EVERRRRR again

name: Tawney Williams
text: Do not use this company! Poor communication between the owner and his employees and them and us should have been my first red flag. The initial estimate almost doubled by the time the job started. Trash and debris left all over my yard every day. Shawty final work that was never inspected by said owner. Finally the work was finished and I had to have them come back out at threat of lawsuit to correct mistakes. Do not use this company!

name: Eli K
text:
This was absolutely the worst experience I've ever had with any car related shop. From the start, I was uneasy about the experience, but I went ahead with it. Huge mistake. I drove by today and a woman who said she was the owner's friend and acting manager waited on me. I asked her to inspect my car to put tint on the driver and passenger windows only. She inspected them and we agreed on a tint grade and a price. Then I walked down the street to the library to wait. About an hour later I decided to head back, and got a call from the manager on my way. She was agitated, and demanded to know if the car had ever had tint on it before. I replied that it may have, I bought it used. She said that they had already started applying tint to one window when they discovered that there was residue from old tint below the window sill. When I got back to the shop, the manager was in a frenzy. She pointed out the residue, and kept going on about how they had "wasted $50 worth of tint". I remained calm and asked them to finish the job. She said they would have to charge me $10 per window extra as a cleanup fee. I refused, saying it was their mistake and they should have inspected the windows more closely before starting (they are the experts, after all). She became very upset and began to shout, again blaming it on me for not telling her about the residue (which, again, was below the windowsill line and not visible). I stood my ground and insisted that it's not my job to know everything, that's why I brought it to a professional. She blew up, began to curse, shout, and refused to look at me in the eye. She shouted at the tint specialist to reassemble my car and send me away. I knew it would cost me even more at another tint shop to have them clean up the messed up tint that was already on my window from Tint Spectrum, so I reluctantly asked the tint specialist what it would take to get the job done right and get be out. He said it would take another $20, so I agreed to pay it. This time, I sat down in the shop and watched them the entire time. I'm not a tint expert by any means, but in my humble opinion, neither are these guys. One of them (who I later found out was the owner) was eating pizza over the hood of my car and asking me whether it was pink or red (it's obviously red). The tint specialist who was working on my car had to rip the tint from the passenger's window, replace it, install tint on the driver's side, rip it off and replace it, and then replace the tint on the passenger's side AGAIN. I'm not sure what he kept messing up, but if each one of those sheets was $50 worth of tint, he easily wasted over $200 worth. The manager continued to stomp around the shop shouting and cursing. The owner didn't seem to care. The tint specialist left lart "3M" logos on my window's right in the middle. The manager asked me if I wanted those removed (who in the world would WANT 3M logos in the middle of their window?).

When it was all said and done, my final bill was $140 before tax, which was $20 higher than agreed upon earlier that morning due to absolutely no fault of my own. The manager remained rude and loud the entire time, and I must have waited in the shop for well over an hour after I got back from the library. The manager offered no apology other than something about "didn't mean to snap earlier". I don't think there is anything in the world that could make me go back to this place or recommend it. The manager is rude, loud, inappropriate and unfair. The staff are very slow, appear to be outrageously incompetent, and are all dirty on top of that (the tint specialist kept spitting tobacco juice on the ground right behind my car). The owner didn't seem to care about anything. I think the quality of the tint is good, since it's 3M. But the service and the installation quality were absolutely not even worth the one star I am forced to grant them. Do not take your car to this place. You will regret it, especially if you have to deal with the manager.

name: Joey Conwill
text: Aaron's was called out to our condo by someone that said they were staying there, had them sign a form then destroyed the lock to let them . It was a combination lock and there was a hidden key that would have overridden the lock if someone had bothered to contact the owner, or called the emergency number posted at the condo office, where a manager lives on the grounds. Aaron's said that was standard procedure, as long as the person signed the form, they could let them in. That's nice for all condo owners to know! Total cost to replace lock, almost $400. Aaron's took no responsibility. Not much integrity at this business.

resp.text: Integrity matters as well as ethical business practices.  We value and employ both in our business.  Emergency response locksmith technicians are there to help in challenging circumstances.  We do everything we can to gain entry before we considering drilling the lock.  This is a last resort.  We are sorry your lock was damaged but your renter misrepresented themselves as having authority to do so and chose to assume liability for such activity, just as they choose to assume liability for their treatment of the rest of your property when they rent from you.  With thousands of condos and hundreds of condo offices that are often closed or unmanned, we cannot track down every owner.  This is why we work hard to go above and beyond the minimum of what the law requires.  We love our customers, we love what we do and we work hard to do it well with integrity.

After a long pause for her to check where he was, I was told if I wanted to call someone, then go ahead. I did. Would never use this company again. All they needed to do differently was keep in touch if ETA changed. I'm locked out of my car with 3 young kids. I found their lack of communication and honestly on ETA unacceptable.

resp.text: Hey Mandy, please if you can send us an email via the contact form our website. I'm so sorry to hear that you had this experience. We aim to take much better care of our customers than this, and though it can get a bit hectic on a Friday night at 10 pm there's still no excuse for lack of communication. I would like to do all that I can to make this better for you.
